questions.question: I .................................. read a lot of books when I was at university.

questions.description: The simple past is the normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about an action or situation that started in the past and has continued up to the present.

questions.question: When I was a child, I ……………………. with my grandparents.

questions.description: The simple past is the normal tense for talking about finished events.

questions.question: The injured child ……………………….. to hospital.
questions.description: Was taken is the passive form of took. We use the passive verb here because the subject is not the doer of the action.

questions.question: Janet ………………………. her job. She is now struggling to make both ends meet.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to talk about a finished event whose effect is still felt in the present.
